settings

Select All
Select None
The letters of each word are scrambled up.
Since the scrambling is random, small words might stay in the correct order. In larger words some letters might still be in the correct spot.
To enter a letter, tap that spot you want to put it in. The spot will be highlighted.
Then tap the letter on the keyboard.
The next letter will automatically be highlighted, you can simply tap the letter on the keyboard to place a new letter on that spot.
You can use the arrows in the keyboard to move the highlight to the side.
The _ will delete an entered letter in the highlight.

When all of the letters are correctly placed the game will let you know that you won and will give you a choice to (1) play another game, (2) go to the main menu or (3) stay on the screen so you can see the solution.
If you\'ve filled in all the letters but don\'t get a popup that means you have an error.
If you get stuck you can use a hint to fill in a random letter.
Each letter has been swapped with another – if E = B, then all Es in the puzzle are B, but that doesn\'t mean that B = E.
To insert a letter into the solution, tap that spot. That spot and all others that correspond to the same letter will be highlighted.
Then tap the letter on the keyboard you want to insert. That letter will be placed in all of the highlighted spaces.
The letters of each column have been moved to the top and scrambled. To solve the puzzle, determine which row each letter “drops” down to.
Start by selecting a square, which will then be highlighted.
Next select a letter from the same column at the top of the puzzle. The letter will be crossed off to show that it\'s been used.
A letter that\'s been crossed off can still be tapped. It will remove that letter from the old location and placed in the new.
You can also change the letter in an already filled square by selecting it and tapping a different top letter. Tapping the same top letter will delete it from the square.
To play a game, select the type of game (ie Cryptogram) from the main menu. It will automatically load a random game for you to play.

If you get a message saying that there are no more games, there are two setting that can be checked to continue playing. Settings can be accessed from the no more games popup, main menu or from the drop down menu in any game ([menu icon] or hardware button, depending on your phone).
Reuse solutions for different games – If you solved “Mary had a little lamb” as a jumble, you can see it again in a drop quote or cryptogram. Checked by default.
Reuse solutions for the same game – If you solved “Mary had a little lamb” as a jumble, you can see it again in a jumble. Not checked by default.
You can also buy more puzzles. A link to the game pack screen can be found on the main menu, settings menu and the no more games message.
In any game you can press the back button to go back to the main menu.
Back
